intro: Haplopappus moyanoi, commonly known as the Mojave pappus, is a flowering plant native to the deserts of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and adapted to arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and has a low, sprawling growth habit to conserve moisture. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in the spring, and the plant produces fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. Haplopappus moyanoi is well adapted to extreme heat and drought, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
